meanings.definition: To sing or call out with a series of rapid, high-pitched sounds.
meanings.sent1: She would jodel joyfully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climber decided to jodel to echo through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The birds joined in her jodel, creating a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to jodel through the room, filling it with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The wind carried her jodel far and wide, reaching distant ears.

meanings.definition: A song or call made in this manner.
meanings.sent1: The jodel echoed across the mountains, a beautiful sound.
meanings.sent2: He listened to the traditional jodel of the alpine region.
meanings.sent3: The jodel of the cowbell choir was surprisingly melodic.
meanings.sent4: The jodel of the wind through the trees was a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The jodel of the waterfall blended with the chirping of birds.
